intro: Cephalomanes madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar sea hare, is a species of sea hare found in the coastal waters of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its elongated, soft body and distinctive coloration. The plant, though marine, exhibits unique botanical features such as a gelatinous mantle and a complex radula structure. It plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for various predators. Its habitat and morphology make it an important subject for studies on marine biodiversity.
